title: White House pressed on Bidens false claim inflation higher everywhere ...
summary: White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre responded to a question about President Biden's claim that US inflation is lower compared to other countries. While Biden stated that Americans are better off, US inflation in May was 8.6%, higher than the Eurozone's 8.1%, South Korea's 5.4%, and lesser than Australia and Canada in recent measures. Jean-Pierre emphasized that inflation is a global issue, exacerbated by the pandemic and the war in Ukraine. Discussing US energy policy, she explained that while Biden urges more oil refining, drilling more is unnecessary; existing oil resources need refining to lower prices. Biden continues to support clean energy proposals despite previously aiming to reduce fossil fuel reliance.
snippet: The annual US inflation rate hit a fresh 40-year high of 8.6% in May, but Biden on Tuesday claimed that Americans are faring better than other countries  even though data from other countries ...

title: Fact check: Biden says 'inflation is higher' in other developed ... - WRAL
summary: President Joe Biden claimed that inflation is higher in other major industrial countries when compared to the United States. This assertion was made during an interview with the Associated Press amid discussions on the high levels of inflation in the U.S. Biden argued that global conditions, such as high oil prices and economic disruptions from the pandemic and the war in Ukraine, are responsible rather than his policies. However, a fact-check reveals that his statement can be interpreted in two ways: comparing current inflation rates of other nations to the U.S., or comparing the current inflation to historical norms within those countries. If Biden meant that other advanced economies have higher inflation rates than the U.S. currently, he is incorrect, as data show that a significant number of countries, including most G-7 nations, have lower inflation rates than the U.S. If his intent was to suggest that these countries are experiencing inflation levels higher than their pre-pandemic rates, then he would be correct. Ultimately, while U.S. policies may have stimulated the economy, contributing to faster economic growth, they have also led to higher inflation compared to international peers. The claim is rated as Half True by PolitiFact.
snippet: Biden said, 'In every other major industrial country in the world Ã¢Â€Â¦ inflation is higher.' Hes right in one sense but wrong in another. Every other major industrialized nation has seen ...

title: Fact Check: Has Inflation Gone Up Every Month of Joe Biden's ... - Newsweek
summary: Inflation in the U.S. has generally been rising during Joe Biden's presidency, with rates increasing from 1.4% in January 2021 to 8.3% in April 2022, and peaking at 8.5% in March 2022, the highest in over 40 years. While House Republicans claim inflation has increased every month of Biden's tenure, this is not entirely accurate. Inflation rates were roughly unchanged from June to September 2021, and there was a slight slowdown in April 2022. Various factors, including the Ukraine conflict, COVID-19 pandemic effects, and fiscal policies, have contributed to these inflation increases. The Biden administration has faced criticism over handling inflation, with approval ratings declining. Efforts to curb inflation, discussed in a White House meeting with Federal Reserve Chairman and Treasury Secretary, are ongoing. Overall, although inflation has risen significantly, the claim that it has increased every single month of Biden's presidency is mostly accurate, given the general upward trend.
snippet: Since he took office, the rate of inflation rose from figures of 1.4% in January 2021 to 8.3% in April 2022, peaking at a more than 40-year historic highs of 8.5% in March 2022. But rates haven't ...

title: Fact check: Biden compares inflation to other countries
summary: In an interview with the Associated Press, President Joe Biden stated, 'If it's my fault, why is it the case in every other major industrial country in the world that inflation is higher?' This claim was noticed by a reader, prompting a fact-check on its accuracy.

title: Biden Falsely Claims Inflation Is Higher in Every Other Major ...
summary: The text largely discusses various political and social issues covered by the Media Research Center (MRC), including recent elections, financial strategies, legal matters, and media transparency. It mentions the firing of a bureaucrat by FEMA for advising aid workers to ignore 'Trump houses', changes in NYC's migrant debit card program, and suggestions for financial inclusion for marginalized groups by the Treasury. The text also highlights media-related concerns like misleading information about jaywalking laws in NYC, job growth figures, and a lawsuit by Trump against CBS. Additionally, it notes a mishap where Colorado voting system passwords were exposed. The MRC, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, aims to challenge perceived media censorship and inaccuracies to uphold American founding values.
snippet: President Joe Biden falsely told the Associated Press (AP) this week that every other major industrial nation in the world has higher inflation that the U.S., and he appeared to repeat the claim at a press event on Thursday. In May, inflation in the U.S. hit a 40-year high, as the Consumer Price Index (CPI) rose 8.6%
